definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He complained there weren't even any hot showers or flush toilets.
sentences.chinese: 他抱怨連熱水浴跟抽水馬桶都沒有。

sentences.english: Install a flush toilet with small pondage.
sentences.chinese: 安裝一個貯水量小的抽水馬桶。

sentences.english: A low-flow showerhead and low-flush toilet save water.
sentences.chinese: 低流量淋浴噴頭和低衝量抽水馬桶可節水。

sentences.english: She would never sit on public toilets.
sentences.chinese: 她決不用公用坐式抽水馬桶。

sentences.english: A toilet training system is installed upon a conventional toilet.
sentences.chinese: 一種排便訓練系統被安裝到普通的抽水馬桶上。

definition: child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
